hint.text: Remember the area of the triangle can be calculated in two ways.

solution.text:
We know :
Area of triangle = \({1\over 2}\times height\times base\)
Since triangle ABC and PQR both are right angled triangle, thus using above formula we have:
Area of ABC = \({1\over 2}\times height\times base\)
i.e, Area of ABC = \({1\over 2}\times a\times b\)
i.e, Area of ABC = \({1\over 2}\times _{i}_\times _{j}_\)
i.e, Area of ABC = \(_{{trunc(Decimal(i)*j/2,2)}}_\)
Similarly,
Area of PQR = \({1\over 2}\times height\times base\)
i.e, Area of PQR = \({1\over 2}\times p\times q\)
i.e, Area of PQR = \({1\over 2}\times _{k}_\times _{{2*i}}_\)
i.e, Area of PQR = \(_{{i*k}}_\)
Thus,
Sum of the areas = \(_{{trunc(Decimal(i)*j/2,2)}}_\)+\(_{{i*k}}_\) = _{{trunc(Decimal(i)*j/2,2)+(i*k)}}_

content.text:
